author: Elana
title: Spinal surgery with excellent results
body: Having suffered with spinal stenosis for more than 5 years I was awaiting surgery. However, due to the COVID pandemic the wait for surgery was prolonged. I was also aware that surgery in my local trust had a backlog of up to 2 years.   In June this year the CCG contacted me with a view to having surgery with Ramsey Health Care, New Hall Hospital in Salisbury. Amazingly I had the surgery in August with excellent results. The whole experience was efficient and professional. I would like to pass my huge thanks to all involved in getting my life back.

title: Good staff offering good patient care
body: For routine diabetic care or for other concerns the response is always thoughtful and appropriate. Under the difficult circumstances of the pandemic the practice has presented a positive face when offering patient care

title: Good Practice
body: The biggest problem was the time taken on the telephone trying to get an appointment. When getting to the surgery the staff were polite and helpful.

title: Excellent practice
body:
I have heard negative reports about Westgate Surgery but I do not believe they are talking about the same practice!

Unfortunately, having to have many dealings over the last two years for myself and my very poorly husband, I cannot fault any part of this practice from the receptionists and nurses to the doctors. They have endeavoured to treat the cause rather than the symptoms in a sympathetic and generously kind and caring manner.
The telephone is always answered and I've never being lower than number three in the queue.
The doctors or other staff always call back within the appointed time.
All the receptionists go out of their way to resolve any queries, whether on the phone or in the surgery.
I don't know  of course, but when waiting, it appears to be a happy work environment which makes me feel confident as a patient.
Top marks to them all.
Come on NHS, give them the recognition they deserve.

As an aside - at one time I had to call another local surgery and I gave  later as each time I was 22 to 24 in the queue!

title: Good practice
body: Suffered flu like symptoms the following day. There was no waiting this year and everything flowed along nicely

title: Terrible appointments system.
body: Theyre currently only running a phone triage service when other practices like royal primary care are offering face to face appointments. Rang this morning at 8am, explained what my issue was  (which is a painful lump behind my ear). Can you email a picture to us of the lump and I'll book you in for a phone call this afternoon. So emailed the picture and waited by my phone all day from 8am this morning and have not received my phone call. This appointment system does not work and its leading to serious cases going undiagnosed, which leads to people ending up seriously unwell.

title: 10 out of 10!
body: After over 20 years at a swiftly deteriorating large local medical group, I thankfully made the decision to move to my local GP surgery - Dalton Terrace. It is seriously the best decision I ever made. Very friendly reception staff - who you can actually speak with - prompt to answer phones (no 'online' forms, impersonal triage systems or rude receptionists); named GPs who actually get to know you and your history (not random GPs and a multitude of locums every time you visit); one surgery (not sent all over the city to lots of different practices nowhere near where you live); swift response to medical requests; prompt invitations to vaccines when eligible; 'on the ball' with ongoing medical conditions and getting in contact for regular reviews. Thank you, Dalton Terrace! You are the jewel in York's crown when it comes to GPs!

title: Speedy response to my worries
body: I’ll admit it is not often I use my doctor’s surgery (no more than once every 2/3 years) as generally I’m not an ‘ill’ person but when I have had any problems I’ve always been seen quickly. An issue has become apparent during covid times which I’ve put off and off, mainly as I wasn’t holding out much hope of being seen anytime soon. My latest experience was making an appointment at reception on Tuesday for a 9am Friday telephone call consultation. During this call the GP agreed he’d like to see me in person and could I be there same day for 11.50am for a quick examination and potential blood tests. Thorough examination complete, bloods taken and a very reassuring chat - I cannot fault the service I’ve received today nor anytime in the past. Thank you Marple Medical Practice.

title: Great helpful practice.
body: I know that like every practice pear tree has issues with getting through on the phone. However, unlike many gp practices this surgery has kept it’s doors open throughout covid, so patients have always had a direct means of contact. Others I know of have just locked their doors and waiting times on the phone have been up to 2 hours. Pear tree also seem to have installed a new phone service, which now tells you where you are in the queue- a big improvement! This practice has worked so hard to get patients vaccinated- their staff were there efficiently running the clinics, so inevitably must have worked such long hours. I have no doubt they are going to be just as effective at delivering the coming booster jabs. Equally I have  also found they have remained reliable at dealing with any urgent situations with phone calls returned and any necessary action taken the same day. The delivery service for repeat prescriptions is totally reliable. I think patients of pear tree should also appreciate the regular reviews of repeat items that not all gp’s carry out. These reviews might occasionally seem a nuisance, but they are great opportunities to discuss any problems with a gp. I could have stayed on some meds for years with my previous Gp without anyone ever checking how I was doing. I wish patients could be more patient, understanding and tolerant of blips in the system when I know staff are doing their best. If staff appear “lazy” because they are not attending the phone or reception it might well be because they have been asked to deal with other areas of work- a lot has to go on behind the scenes too to progress patients needs. Also we are all human, so inevitably some mistakes will occur- can we not be a little more tolerant and understanding where professionals are doing their best.  If there are any truly worrying incidents of course they must be reported, but otherwise why not just be polite and thankful that we have a gp service that I guarantee is better than many others. There is a patient group that you could join to to help improve services- of course everything can always use positive suggestions to improve.

title: Helpful Receptionist
body: After a worrying hospital appointment I was put at ease after speaking to a receptionist. She was really helpful and listened to my worries. She made me a GP appointment for that day, thank you. The GP was very helpful too. Thank you all.

title: The whole hospital is a joke
body: I have visited this hospital numerous times in the last couple months, to start off the doctors I've seen can be hilariously misinformed, like someone telling me to go to rochdale infirmary for eye problems without informing me id need a referral leading to wasted money and time going only to get turned away, to doctors being outright rude, to having my gp tell me to visit the AE department only to wait 10 hours to see a doctor just to get told to visit my GP. but the most hilariously awful experience I've had is with the eye clinic section, I waited 3 hours to get seen, I literally saw the slit lamp they had in the dept and they had opthalmoscopes literally right behind me and I got told they "couldn't examine my eye, the whole hospital is a joke and the management seriously need to evaluate who they are hiring

title: Thankyou for all you do!!
body:
I felt I had to review and support my fantastic GP practice following all the negativity and GP bashing that is going on in the media lately.
The Surgery have been brilliant over the pandemic and have continued to see patients face to face. I have been seen twice when the Gp thought an examination was needed. Other family members have also been seen. Please don’t believe everything you read online. Doctors, nurses and receptionists are all amazing. It’s a lovely surgery with a pleasant atmosphere. Highly recommended.

title: Contacting surgery
body: After receiving a text from the surgery about another blood test I rang 5 times on Friday 24th September 2021. Each time after waiting in the queue for ages when get to 1st or 2nd in line I get cut off..I don't know if its for me or my wife as we have both had blood tests done. Pearls at City hospital me at the surgery. Its worrying not knowing what is happening or which of us its for. Cannot get to see a doctor and seems Cannot get in touch with surgery either..it would be nice to know what is happening to whichever one of us its for. Instead of just being sent for more blood tests. Obviously the one we have had is not conclusive but that lead us to worry what is wrong.

title: Extremely competent team
body: Attended earlier today for a guided epidural. Was most impressed and inspired by how the team operated, filling me with a confidence for the procedure involved.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust (2)

title: Poor GP surgery
body: First of all i would like to thank the nurse tobye who is brilliant. He makes the surgery a bit better and only person who can actually take bloods properly but the front line staff ie receptionists do not know what they are doing. They are overwhelmed and short staffed but also their faces look like they are on a rollercoaster. Wind swept faces with no smile present. The surgery is disorganised and not sure what the manager / partners are doing. Nothing like it use to be. A family member came out of hospital and NOTHING was actioned when we even sent the letter. Chasing up prescriptions all the time. Need to fix up

title: Excellent service
body: I have always received great care at the practice and today was no exception.  I contacted the practice not knowing when I could be seen and the receptionist was really helpful and arranged for a telephone consultation today.  The Dr called this afternoon and i received a thorough telephone consultation with a prescription arranged and picked up today.. The GP was kind, caring and helpful,  Thank you for such a great service.

title: Wonderful team
body: Thank you to the whole team at Didsbury Medical Centre. I’m very anxious about wasting GPs time with unnecessary issues but the practice are always more than reassuring and kind with their time. Today was no exception. From the telephone call with the GP, speaking to the administration and reception team and the face to face appointment. Thank you for being understanding, patient and incredibly helpful. Thank you so much.

title: Faultless care
body: Everyone from the ambulance crew to the doctors and nurses who involved during my very recent admission for a heart problem were on top of their game. I don't think I have ever seen people pull together so efficiently, and that combined with the warmth and obviously high professional standards means that I would not want to be treated anywhere else. Not after that stay. My heartfelt thanks go to everyone who helped me.

title: Kind, compassionate an outstanding practice
body:
Wonderful reception team, who always are extremely polite even when under pressure. The most thorough GPs who are kind, caring and provide helpful advice. 
I feel very lucky to be a patient at this practice.

title: Flu Clinic
body: I attended the flu clinic on 18th September. Very well organised, full marks to everyone involved, thank you.

title: Flu jab clinic
body:
Attended today with my wife for our flu jabs
 Greeted at door and hands sanitised. Directed into immediate side room.. ID checked and previous flu jab history confirmed.  Jabbed and record updated. Out through an open side door.  
Perfect experience and simple in its efficiency and execution. Five stars.

title: Outstanding
body: Contrary to other reviews, I found both the administration  and medical staff to be helpful, polite, caring and efficient. Despite requiring consultation and x-rays, there was no delay in any aspect of my diagnosis. No actual treatment was required during my visit but I was given clear and sound care advice with arrangements being made for potential further investigations and treatment. Peterborough can be thankful and proud to have this unit.

readBy.name: Lincolnshire Community Health Services NHS Trust

title: Fantastic Practice
body:
Having had previous bad experiences from another practice in Darwen, my wife and I moved to Springfield Surgery.
They have been an absolute breath of fresh air comparatively, extremely helpful and accommodating.
In the relatively short time that we have been patients, we could not commend Springfield Surgery highly enough.
From receptionist to Clinical staff.,.all
are absolutely ace!

title: Amazing service
body: Westfield Surgery, Woking. I would like credit to be given to the whole team at this practice. They provide a top class  professional service, with patience and kindness, incredible when one considers the pressures they need to manage. I am fortunate to be registered with this Practice. Thank you.

title: Great Practice
body: I had a great call out of the blue from a GP following up my tests and and chatting about my health. The GP I had seen who had ordered these asked him to check up on me and my results whilst he was away!  I was amazed and very happy about this and we had a good chat about various ailments to which he has referred me for another test.  He was very easy to talk to and was interested in how I am.

title: Wonderful service
body: Needed to discuss new symptoms. Appointment made for next day. Seen in person. Blood samples taken. Results discused with Dr. that afternoon by telephone. Way forward discussed and agreed. Prescription altered immediately. I could not have wished for a better service from all concerned.

title: Flu vaccination appointments
body: Well organised. Everyone friendly and helpful. In and out extremely quickly. Very good experience. Would highly recommend.

title: Fabulous practice and staff
body: I’ve been to have my flu jab and also taken my father who is 93. We were shown straight in, no waiting and lovely staff. A fantastic 1 way system and live music. This surgery have always been good and efficient. Thank you Horizon.

title: Not sincere
body: My overall review is based on collective experiences with this practice over the last few years, they were mostly before COVid and just one or two occurrences in the last two years. I generally have nothing but praise for everyone in the medical profession and every kind of care worker in this country and around the world. So, it’s unfortunate to share my particular experience with this practice. I'll start by saying that just thinking about telephoning for an appointment leads to anxiousness as it can take forever to get through. If you don't have 30 minutes or an hour plus to spare waiting in a telephone queue, they advise that appointments can be made online. I've tried that too but honestly, their website is awful to navigate and when I did finally manage to find and successfully submit the correct form to book an appointment, I discovered 10 days later when following up that it hadn't been received. On one occasion I arrived five minutes early for my allotted appointment time, but wasn't seen for an entire hour later. On this occasion when seen, I felt that the GP was rude and disrespectful, as the GP showed very little concern that I had been waiting. I felt that their apology was reluctant and insincere. Also, throughout the appointment, the GP had an unsympathetic bedside manner and I found the appointment awkward. On another occasion, I did manage to get connected on the telephone and speak with someone only to be told to email them. On this occasion my email was answered the same day, however the information I was expecting back didn't arrive, and only after following up nearly two weeks later, I was advised that they had replied by email. On these occasions with sensitive emailed information, most people would 'forward' their previous response showing that they had been sincere and responded in a timely manner, rather than sending a new response. Thus feeling like you’re unimportant and it’s just fobbed-off as an email issue.

title: Credits to the NHS
body:
I visited the Emergency Department yesterday/early hours of this morning with a very nasty cut to my knee. Every single staff member I dealt with was incredible. They treated me like I was the only patient I had (when in actual fact they were incredibly busy) and they were upbeat, understanding and supportive. 
I cannot put into words how wonderful they were and how much better they made me feel. Amazing!

title: Great service
body: Attended for flu jab. So easy, well organised. Great service. Easy to park met at entrance verbal directions were exact, hand sanitizer given. No wait, straight in and after a few direct questions in went the needle, didn't feel a thing. Out through rear entrance. Great system worked like clockwork.

title: Really good service
body: Telephoned the practice and was given the choice that they would telephone me back when I was near the top of the queue, what a good system. Receptionist really helpful and arranged telephone appointment with Dr. later that day at my convenience. Dr. telephoned, we had a helpful discussion and she prescribed the medication and forwarded the prescription. I collected the medication and by the end of the day was taking it. you could not get a better service than this. well done Lombard Medical Centre for being so efficient at this difficult time.

title: Flu vaccinations
body:
Just been in for our flu jabs. All very well organised and smooth. We were in and out in 5 mins. 
Staff all friendly and helpful

title: Great emergency care
body:
Recently had to visit A&E for severe abdominal pain which was later diagnosed as an Appendicitis.
Even though I had to wait initially to be seen due to the back log from the night before,the care I received was really good,I can not fault the staff from A&E to the discharge lounge all in all despite the shock of having to have surgery for my appendix at 63 I can not fault the care I received.

title: Efficient flu jab procedure
body: Very well organised and covid safe . All patients given time slot. Checked in at desk then very short wait. Went to designated nurse and were asked some medical questions and then flu jab was administered. Left nurses room and went out of surgery by rear entrance so didn’t come into contact with any other patients. It was a good idea having free car parking so no queue at pay machine.

title: Excellent and friendly team
body: Had my flu jab this morning. Extremely good organisation, friendly staff. Made me feel good to enter the surgery 👍

title: WELL DONE BURLEIGH HOUSE
body: Left home 9.30am, had flu injection in the car because of disability. Back home 10am.  Staff were fantastic.  Well thought out. Thankyou

title: Really excellent support
body: I accidentally smashed the bottle of my son's epilepsy medication and had none left coming up to the weekend, I rang the surgery to see if they could issue me any as an emergency, both the pharmacist and receptionist were so helpful, they ordered an extra bottle and when it didn't turn up as expected, they went out of their way to find an alternative supplier, which included proactively calling me in the evening with suggestions to try.  They ordered some more again which thankfully arrived the next day and were so lovely and polite when I picked it up, even apologising for the delay (which absolutely wasn't their fault).  I found this to be a really personal and supportive service at a time of great stress.  % stars and thank you so much!

title: Very helpful
body:
Had a flu jab today very organised and no queues 
I have always had a good response from this practice

title: OK overall
body:
Reception staff never look happy, can see you waiting at the door but don't acknowledge you and not quick to come to you.
The surgery needs to get back open if pubs,nightclubs,shops are open why can't doctors resume normal service, colder days will be coming soon and wet weather,patients should not be expected to stand outside.

title: Excellent Practice
body: Just had my Flu Jab ,no waiting just straight in ,Very well organized Thank You. Once again very well done ,The Grange surgery.

title: Flu jab
body: After receiving my invitation I booked an appointment online for my flu jab. I arrived 5 mins early and was seen immediately by a friendly and efficient lady and was promptly given my vaccination. She informed me I was eligible for a pneumonia jab but after checking I was asked to make a future appointment as I had been given my booster injection just the day before. Better safe than sorry!

title: First Class Practice
body:
Went for flu jab which was organised by the practice at a local church hall
Excellent organisation, friendly and efficient staff.
Thank you

title: Lovely doctors
body:
BUT, this has happened twice to me - I ring and get a message saying due to the high volume of calls they are unable to take my call !!!!!
The general wait time before the phone is picked up, for me, is about 29 minutes.
They dealt with the Covid crisis well, and no doubt soon we will be called for the annual flu jab.
The doctors are very nice but, they take on a number of new doctors presumably coming for the experience, which means each time you call about something you tend to speak to a different doctor. There are in excess of 12 GP's therefore the number of patients is very high.  The nursing staff are excellent. The wait to get through to speak to someone I find extremely poor, it's quicker sometimes to drive down and ask them.

title: Receptionist kept me calm
body: On Friday evening I came to the surgery panicked as my medication had not been sent to the pharmacy as yet. The receptionist at the window said it was waiting to be signed and would be sent to the pharmacy and I went into a state of panic as I had no medication. The receptionist calmed me down and said she would message a Dr to see if it could be done before my pharmacy closed, mind this was half hour before my pharmacy would close. While she was waiting for a reply she kept talking to me to help me stay calm and within 10 minutes she informed me the Dr had sent my prescription to the pharmacy. I am so grateful for her and the surgery going out off their way to help patients like me who suffer from severe anxiety. Thank you

title: Dependable and Accomodating
body: Very proactive and helpful. Always call ahead for appointments and are very helpful. Good team of Doctors, Nurses and support staff. Have been there on a few occasions for my annual check and have had no problems at all. I would highly recommend this practice.

title: Always helpful
body: Thanks to all at Swarland during challenging times. As a GP myself I know how difficult it has been. Thanks for all you do.

title: Annual Flu Jab
body: Friendly greeting, efficient and welcoming, all we come expect from the caring staff of Jorvik-Gillygate Practice. My experience this morning was faultless.

title: Superbly organised flu jab
body: It was a pleasure this morning coming in for my flu jab. Good welcome, organised queue and several injection slots. My nurse and helper were fantastic and I was literally in and out in less than 5 mins. Great job

title: Fantastic friendly staff
body: Recent blood appointment for cancer treatment was excellent. Reception staff were polite and helpful in assisting me to book an appointment in time for treatment. The HCA who took my blood was helpful, friendly and patient as I can be difficult to get blood from. Much more convenient than having to use the LRI walk-in blood clinic.

title: Brilliant practice
body: We had our flu jabs today and it was really well organised and COVID safe. The staff are always helpful and the doctors always make enough time to listen to your concerns. This is a really good practice.

title: Amazing Service
body: I am always really pleased with the care received from the surgery. All the receptionists and Clinicians are always willing to go over and beyond to ensure their patients receive the best care possible. I would recommend this surgery to everyone moving to the area. I cannot thank all the staff enough!

title: Great practice
body: Invited for covid booster jab. Excellent service and very friendly atmosphere. It was very convenient for me to attend and there was no waiting for my timed appointment. Many thanks.

title: Caring Practice
body: All the staff, receptionists, nurses, healthcare and doctors always treat me with kindness and do their best to help. There is sometimes a wait for an appointment but when I have needed urgent care, which has happened this year, I have always been seen. I cannot thank them enough for the care they provide under enormous pressure.

title: Fantastic GP surgery  wouldn't be with any other
body:
I just wanted to say how grateful I am to have such a caring, efficient
fantastic GP surgery, the best I've ever had. They always have time for you. Even through these trying times they have given their best care. The reception and nursing staff have all done a wonderful job too. Thank you.

title: Thank you thank you thank you!
body:
I have had lots of contact with dermatology this year as I needed multiple surgeries. I would like to send a massive thank you to the team, everyone of you has helped in some way. You put me at ease every time I visited and showed such understanding and kindness when I needed it, every single time. 

Thank you nurses, surgeons, receptionists, coordinators and every one else! You are amazing :)

title: Dermatology department…brilliant
body:
Visited the Ashton Centre today the 24th September 2021 for a suspected cancerous spot being removed by surgery, was a little nervous, but the staff were brilliant and friendly, the surgeon was the same, chatty and friendly and put me at ease. The procedure was carried out without discomfort or pain.
Thank you for your skill and care.

title: Excellent GP practice
body: The GP I saw for my postnatal and baby check was excellent. Very caring and thorough. She put me at ease and I felt able to share any concerns I had. Also had great experiences with all the GPs I saw for my pregnancy checks - all very friendly and able to answer any questions I had. Very happy with the surgery.

title: Very good service throughout pandemic
body: I attended St Chads for a flu vaccine today. Very well organised, quick throughput and painless vaccine administered. Throughout the covid period I have used the surgery services on several occasions and been given great service and care throughout, from reception staff nurses and doctors. Thank you very much.

title: Good staff
body: Drs are good - and nursing staff pleasant and helpful.  As with any go surgery at present very difficult to get an appointment - can be frustrating

title: Good patient care
body: Flu jab in local Church Hall.  Very efficient and friendly despite the pressures.  Other services I have accessed this year equally good, coronavirus pressures notwithstanding

title: Super efficient flu jab clinic today
body: Marazion surgery has always been great for us . Today was my flu jab - so well organised - in and out in minutes , no waiting , felt very safe and everyone was so friendly and cheerful .

title: Contact frustration
body: Trying right now to book mine and my husband's flu jabs with a ten point instruction on my mobile in one hand and my landline phone in the other! What happens - nothing! The number given isn't connecting, there are no instructions apart from the first greeting and then utter silence. Is this happening to other people or is it just me?

title: Best flu jab campaign ever!
body:
This review is with reference to the 2021 Flu vaccination campaign. The Jorvik Gillygate practice made this process so efficient, starting with a text in plenty of time to allow the vulnerable to be vaccinated early in the flu season. They also provided a timetable of vaccination slots, each 3 minutes apart, which ensured the patients did not have to queue longer than perhaps 1 minute at the most.
Finally, the staff were all very welcoming and efficient.

title: Care, professionalism and openness
body:
Sadly lost my father after a very quick illness and short stay in Macclesfield General, Ward 3.

Just felt I needed to share how great the nursing staff were, I'm rubbish with names but in particular a few stood out with their outstanding support,  compassion and care. They will know who they are if they read this.

The Doctors were very clear with their information sharing which enabled me to make informed decisions. 

Travelling up and down from the North East to spend, sadly limited time with my father was certainly made easier by these great peoples consideration, support and understanding, not to mentioned cups of coffee which helped with all that driving. 

Sadly my Dad passed away on Friday 25th September but thanks to these great people, his final days were made more comfortable, both for him and my family.

Thank you and God Bless.

Denis Heaney

title: Fantastic practice
body:
The flue clinic that I attended was brilliantly organised and the staff were fantastic. Everyone was friendly and very efficient. My husband and I have attended the surgery several times over the last few months and have received first class care. My husband phoned at 08.00 one morning, the doctor phoned back and he had a face to face appointment the same morning which is fantastic service.
I would recommend this surgery as the service and staff are brilliant  and  everyone  goes the extra mile to help patients

title: Flu Clinic
body: Flu Clinic this morning.   Perfect.  Well organised, welcoming staff team, a very efficient service.

title: Great experience
body: We had a telephone consultation for my 2 year old son in July. It was very easy to get an appointment. The GP called a couple of hours later, assessed the problem and asked for a photo. They prescribed some antibiotic cream and my son improved within days. Great experience. There’s a lot of negative press about GPs currently and it’s just putting extra pressure on GP practices. They are working flat out to care for their patients so I am extremely grateful to the GP we spoke to.

title: Flu Jab
body:
Outstanding today.
Well organised and I had my jab exactly at 11.55 as scheduled.
Credit where credits due

title: Safe, courteous and efficient
body: Myself and wife had flu injection appointments here instead of Armada surgery. Every and everyone from the lady greeting at door to leaving surgery were polite friendly safe and efficient. Thanks to them all.

title: Flu clinic
body: This visit was amazingly quick and well organised - best it's ever been. Plenty of staff to direct you and very importantly all smiley. Could almost say I enjoyed having my 'jab'!

title: Efficient practice
body: I attended for my annual flu jab it was extremely well organised in and out in five minutes and all the staff very friendly

title: Very slick appointment
body: Attended for my flu jab. Booked in, allocated a room, waited 2 minutes, had my jab and gone. Fantastic !

title: Good combination of treatment
body:
In last year due to my husbands complex conditions we have had contact with surgery on several occasions. 

This has been a mixture of remote and face to face which have proved the perfect combination . I have also had similar combination which has been exactly what I needed.

 One telephone consultation recently leading to face to face follow up within 24 hours.   

 The admin staff are always polite and helpful and we have always been offered option of face to face which in cases of reviews and follow up consultation we have made decision , covid not withstanding telephone was best . Less travel for us efficient  use of doctors time and safer all round in times of covid.

title: Flu Vaccination
body:
As usual very efficient and friendly. Both my wife and myself received our Flu vaccinations. 
That's all I need to say.
Thanks for today

title: Confused and rude
body: I visited for my second vaccine today and it was very confused and I was very concerned how the big red box saying the batch number was out of date suddenly disappeared after a lot of clicking and moving computers. Then, I was told I could leave when I hadn't even had the vaccine. I had the vaccine but I don't feel that the process was thorough or that any after care was given. I'm glad I never need to go back.

title: Flu clinic
body: Really easy to book the appointment. Very well organised on the day. Friendly, efficient, welcoming staff. I didn't feel the needle and I can't see the mark. Excellent. Took just a few minutes. Thank you for making it such a positive experience and for giving up your Saturday to do this.

title: Good care
body: I attend the gynaecology ward for an hysterectomy and I cannot praise all the staff enough. My aftercare was second none and although constantly busy nothing was too much trouble for them. I would like to take this opportunity to thank all the staff on ward 3e gynae for all of their help and care especially at a time of uncertainty.

readBy.name: St Helens and Knowsley Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Flu Jab
body: Had my Flu Jab today and the service and ease of access to the surgery was excellent. The Staff and Nurses were very Polite and helpful. Straight in and out.

title: Great service
body: Once we showed blue badge we were shown to the correct parking.  My mum was identified as frail when we arrived.  The greeting lady personally took us to be logged in and fast tracked past the Queue so mum wouldn’t have to stand too long.  Everyone was helpful and caring.  This was at the Greendale vaccination centre near Exeter.

title: Thanks for excellent support at weekend via 111…
body: I had been experiencing great pain for several weeks that Paracetamol and ibuprofen did not help. it now seems I may have polymyalgia rheumatica. On Saturday 11th September, I rang my pharmacist (Rowlands Festing Buildings) for advice in getting better pain relief whilst I waited for gp surgery to get back to me. He was excellent advised I ring 111. So, I did, waited on the phone queue for at least 30 minutes but needed to stick with it. Then I got connected to a male operator and we went through my problems and that ultimately, I needed better pain relief over weekend whilst GP shut. He made all the notes advised I needed the ooh GP to prescribe stuff and said that GP would ring within 2 hrs. As I put the phone down the GP was instantly on the phone. She listened to my symptoms and prescribed the painkillers and something to help me sleep a bit better, both in line with the suggestions the pharmacist made. She said she'd sent the prescription to Festing Buildings which shuts at 1pm on Saturday and marked it urgent. My husband drove me round there and the pharmacist had it ready. I took my first co-codamol at about 1145. The 111 waiting time seems a bit daunting but I needed some help so I had to hang on. From there the service and support I had was brilliant. It gives me great pleasure so say THANK YOU to the people I interacted with that day. I thought the help I received that day was outstanding.

title: A very young caring and friendly GP.
body: What can I say. Brilliant ! M'y GP listened to me, reassured me and above all I was at wads and could talk easily. My GP is absolutely fantastic. It's a shame that earlier this week, I was informed that I cannot have individual appointments. Seeing GPs who  are aware of one's condition and with whom one has a good rapport is essential for one well being.

title: Excellent Service
body:
Just recieved flu jab at St Chads Church, service was extremely efficient, the staff were highly prossesional and helpful.
Please give a big thankyou to all involved.

title: 10 Hour 111 Call back (promised 2 hours)
body: I rang the 111 service as was a weekend and my 2 year old had had 12 episodes of being sick in 3 hours. Knowing how busy A&E is due Covid did not want to attend hospital unless needed to but didnt know what was recommended with having a child being so sick who is so little. The call handler from 111 was brilliant and helped me answer all the questioned needed for the initial assessment. Was told a clinian would phone within 2 hours but did not hear from anyone for over 10 hours! Appreciate this is a crazy time for the NHS but was left worrying if should be taking my child for urgent health care or not and when finally did get a call the nurse I spoke to was hurrying me along as admitted was close to breaching their deadlines. The 111 service clearly needs investment to release other services such as A&E and ambulance services as on weekends people dont have alternatives available. Luckily my child is now ok but having seeing a GP since have been recommended to go to hospital if have a repeat event. I hope this review can be used to highlight the need for investment of the 111 service not to be critial of an already struggling service.

title: Flu vaccine
body: Attended today for my flu vaccine. Friendly staff, well organised, swift service. Great job Pathfields!

title: Very Efficient Flu Vaccination
body: Went for my flu jab this morning. No Queue. Very efficient conveyor belt system in operation. Just what was needed. Thank you.

title: Flu jab drop in clinic
body: I attended the drop-in flu jab clinic today 25/09/21 during my allocated time slot 10-11am. As per usual all staff were pleasant, polite and helpful. Everything was streamlined, well organised and efficient and there were plenty of parking spaces. Well done all!

title: Flu jab
body: Just been for flu shot at st chads excellent service & thank you no waiting or queuing plenty of car parking spaces was in and out in no time

title: Annual flu Injection
body: Very well organised and friendly staff. I was most impressed at the slickness of the operation. ++++

title: Almost inaccessible A&E
body:
Never been to A&E before, but had to rush my 3 month old daughter there recently. 

The A&E entrance is extremely confusing!
You drive in on the right side of the road!? (We’re in the UK). What’s that about?

Then there’s absolutely nowhere to stop. It’s basically just a car park for police cars. 
Nothing at all for the public to use. 

After looping back through a second time, it still wasn’t clear where we were supposed to go. 

Wife and 3 month old just had to bail out of the car in the middle of the road. 

Then they had to look for the entrance, which wasn’t obvious, as it was hidden behind a covid tent. 
  
I’m sure it’s fine if you know it… but for those of us who visit once or twice in a lifetime, it’s extremely confusing and counterintuitive. It couldn’t have been designed worse if it was intentionally done badly. 

Of all the things that need quick access lay-bys and clear direction, it is A&E. 
It needs to be clear to find where you’re going when you’re new to visiting and you’re in a panic. 
Yet At Salford, it’s this hidden little part of the hospital, tucked around a corner.

readBy.name: Salford Royal NHS Foundation Trust (Renal AQuA)

title: Flu clinic
body: Today I went for my flu jab.  This was booked via the contact us link on the new website, I simply requested an appointment having received my letter and a message came back with the appointment time within the hour.  Got a lift to the surgery jumped out at the bus stop, nurse was waiting, flu jab into my arm and back into the car before my driver had had chance to pull out into the traffic.  Very nearly a drive-thu jab.  And this on a Saturday lunchtime. Brilliant service thank you Red Roofs.

title: We’ll organise FluJab
body:
Drove into car park and we’re greeted and given instructions to drive into the marquee. Details taken and injection administered by lovely friendly nurses. 
Drove home happy all done without having to struggle out of the car.

title: Excellent practice
body: Having heard bad reviews of this practise I was worried as a new complex patient, however, I really cannot fault them.  The receptionists were professionally and beyond helpful and the doctor I spoke to was outstanding.

title: Great practice
body:
I took my relative for his Flu vaccinated today at St Chads church hall.
He was very reluctant to have this vaccine but as he has Dementia and Cancer, I felt that it was important for him to be vaccinated.
All the staff were very polite, courteous, helpful and reassuring.
As an unpaid carer for my relative, I have always found ALL the staff at the Jorvik Gillygate practice very helpful and accommodating to his needs.
The staff always go over and above to support me and my relative.
We feel like real people and not just a number.
Despite the challenges of the Covid 19 Pandemic and the pressures that ALL the staff are under, we have found them to be always polite, courteous, professional and extremely supportive to us.
I am very grateful to them all as caring for my relative has many challenges for me.

title: Great Flu jab clinic
body: Well organised, proactive service for annual flu jab. Arrived early, seen straight away and all completed within 5 minutes

title: Excellent service
body: We attended the Flu Clinic today -  fast, efficient, friendly and highly professional. Highly impressive.

title: Simply wonderful
body: Was fortunate to go to this practice for both covid jabs and my booster. The staff and volunteers are outstanding. What a fantastic experience due to the friendly, affable and caring staff. The facilities are great but I was deeply impressed by how efficient and well planned the whole operation is. Hats off to you! Considering the pressure that the service and staff are under it is nothing short of impeccable.

title: Horrible practice
body:
The waiting times are unbelievable and that was before the pandemic
Doctors and nurses don't seem to pass information to each other
You get cut off after so long on the phone waiting
And
Why does a receptionist need to know why I want appointment? 
Why do I need a receptionist judging about a physically and mentally for my problems
And lastly
No one in the doctors can keep to a schedule at all!
Absolutely ridiculous

title: Caring and helpful staff at all levels
body: I attended a clinic Sept 24 2021. Everyone was helpful, informative, and patient. A urology visit can be intimidating - from the consultant to the nurses, all took time to explain what was happening and what to expect. The clinic was meant to end at midday, in fact it ended much later. Despite this pressure, I was kept fully informed throughout and made to feel welcome. The fact I am deaf and had problems hearing through masks was tactfully dealt with. Outstanding care and quality of service, thank you all

title: Flu Clinic
body:
Went to St Chads church hall today for jab. Very impressed well
run and efficient. Social distancing in operation. In and out in 
no time at all. Thanks you
